title: I'm over Meta
text:
I've been a user of Facebook and Instagram for years, but lately, I've become increasingly unhappy with the apps. The latest updates have been particularly bad, making the user experience frustrating and confusing.

One of the biggest issues with these apps is their algorithm, which seems to prioritize ads and irrelevant content over posts from people and pages I actually care about. I'm tired of scrolling through endless ads and sponsored posts just to find something interesting to look at.

Another problem is the constant changes to the interface. It seems like every time I open the app, there's something new and confusing to navigate. The updates often seem to make things more complicated and less user-friendly, rather than improving the overall experience.

Moreover, I'm concerned about the privacy implications of using these apps. Facebook has been in hot water for its data practices in the past, and I worry that my personal information is being shared without my knowledge or consent. I don't feel comfortable using an app that puts my privacy at.

Overall, I would not recommend the Facebook and Instagram apps. While they do offer some benefits, such as staying connected with friends and family, the downsides are significant. The algorithm, constant updates, privacy concerns, and endless advertisements all contribute to a negative user experience. If you're looking for a more positive and fulfilling online experience, I would suggest looking elsewhere.
